text: {| id="drugInfoBox" style="float: right; clear: right; margin: 0 0 0.5em 1em; background: #ffffff;" class="toccolours" border=0 cellpadding=0 align=right width="240px" |- | align="center" colspan="2" | Illustration of HLA-DQ with peptide in the binding pocket |- | align="center" colspan="2" | major histocompatibility complex, class II, DQ3 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | Haplotypes | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | DQA1*0303:DQB1*0301 DQA1*0401:DQB1*0301 DQA1*0505:DQB1*0301 DQA1*0601:DQB1*0301 DQA1*03:DQB1*0302 DQA1*0301:DQB1*0303 |- | colspan="2" bgcolor="#dddddd" | Structure (See HLA- DQ) |-style="background:#f8f8f8" | bgcolor="#dddddd" | Identifiers|| align="center" | alpha 1 *0301 *0302 *0303 *0401 *0505 *0601 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | Symbol(s) | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | HLA-DQA1 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | EBI-HLA | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | DQA1*0301 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | EBI-HLA | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | DQA1*0302 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | EBI-HLA | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | DQA1*0303 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | EBI-HLA | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | DQA1*0401 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | EBI-HLA | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | DQA1*0505 |-style="background:#f8f8f8" | bgcolor="#dddddd" | Identifiers|| align="center" | beta 1 *0301 *0302 *0303 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | Symbol(s) | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | HLA-DQB1 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | EBI-HLA | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | DQB1*0301 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | EBI-HLA | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | DQB1*0302 |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | EBI-HLA | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | DQB1*0303 |- | colspan="2" bgcolor="#dddddd" | Shared data |- | bgcolor="#e7dcc3" | Locus | bgcolor="#eeeeee" | chr.6 6p21.31 |- |} HLA-DQ3 (DQ3) is a broad serotype category with split antigens HLA-DQ7, DQ8, and DQ9. Historically, originally recognized as MB3 a DC4 serotype, DQw3 was one of three early determined antigens recognized as HLA-DQ along with HLA-DQ1 and HLA-DQ2. While the DQ3 molecules are structurally similar in beta chain, the DQ molecules differ markedly in function, even when present with the same DQ alpha subunit. For this reason they are best treated independently. ==Serology== {| border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align="left" style="text-align:center; background:#ffffff; margin-right: 1em; border:2px #e0e0ff solid;" |+ DQ3, DQ7, DQ8, and DQ9 recognition of Some DRB1*and derived from IMGT/HLA |- style="background:#f0f0ff" | style="width:60px" | DQB1* || style="width:60px" | DQ7 | style="width:60px" | DQ3 || style="width:60px" | DQ8 || style="width:60px" | Sample |- style="background:#f0f0ff" | allele || % || % || % || size (N) |- | style = "background:#e8e8f8" | 0301 || 85 || 40 || 1 || 12220 |- | style = "background:#e8e8f8" | 0304 || 40 || 35 || 8 || 111 |- | style = "background:#e8e8f8" | || || || || . |- style="background:#f0f0ff" | style="width:60px" | || style="width:60px" | DQ8 | style="width:60px" | DQ3 || style="width:60px" | DQ7 || style="width:60px" | N |- | style = "background:#e8e8f8" | 0302 || 66 || 25 || 1 || 6657 |- | style = "background:#e8e8f8" | 0305 || 34 || 30 || || 70 |- style="background:#f0f0ff" | style="width:60px" | || style="width:60px" | DQ9 | style="width:60px" | DQ3 || style="width:60px" | DQ2 || style="width:60px" | N |- | style = "background:#e8e8f8" | 0303 || 67 || 12 || 11 || |- style="background:#f0f0ff" | style="width:60px" | || style="width:60px" | | style="width:60px" | DQ7 || style="width:60px" | DQ8 || style="width:60px" | N |- | style = "background:#e8e8f8" | 0303 || || 1 || 1 || 2563 |- |} The serotyping efficiency of DQ3 recognition relative to DQ2, DQ7, DQ8, and DQ9 is shown to the left. Compared to DQ2 serotyping of DQB1*0201 positive individuals (98%), the efficiency of DQ3 recognition is relatively low and error prone. This compares to genotyping efficiency of 100%. The recognition of DQB1*0303 by DQ9 and or DQ3 is poorest, DQ2 which recognizes a different DBB1*group recognizes DQB1*0303 as efficiently as DQ3. For this reason DQ3 serotyping is a poor method of typing for transplantation or disease association prediction or study. Nonetheless, it is still widely used and association purported in the literature. ==Alleles== ===DQB1*0301=== DQB1*0301 the DQ7 gene, is detailed on HLA-DQ7 ===DQB1*0302=== DQB1*0302 the DQ8 gene, is detailed on HLA-DQ8 ===DQB1*0303=== DQB1*0303 the DQ9 gene, is detailed on HLA-DQ9 ===DQB1*0304=== DQB1*0304 is similar in structure and function to DQB1*0301 generally considered to be HLA-DQ7 ===DQB1*0305=== DQB1*0305 is similar in structure and function to DQB1*0302 generally considered to be HLA-DQ8 ==References== Category:HLA-DQ haplotypes
title: HLA-DQ3
